articles.author: Claire Keeton
articles.title: The lows, the highs and the trauma of bipolar disorder - TimesLIVE
articles.description: Misdiagnosed and misunderstood, bipolar disorder can strike without warning, writes Claire Keeton. South Africa’s high stress levels and poor public health service make things worse

articles.author: Lethabo Malatsi
articles.title: AKA buys a R2m BMW, asks Elon Musk for aid yet again - The Citizen
articles.description: AKA has asked Twitter's new owner to help solve South Africa's energy crisis.
articles.content:
South African rapper Kiernan “AKA” Forbes has ample reasons to celebrate, from his growing budding romance with girlfriend Nadia Nakai and now his whooping two million rand whip.

articles.title: Wanted Ireland fugitive found in KZN prison - eNCA
articles.description: Interpol South Africa has tracked down a wanted Ireland fugitive in a KwaZulu-Natal correctional centre.
articles.content:
JOHANNESBURG - Interpol South Africa has tracked down a wanted Ireland fugitive in a KwaZulu-Natal correctional centre.
Neville Van Der Westhuize is serving a 15-year-jail sentence for murder. 
The… [+392 chars]

articles.author: Cebelihle Mthethwa
articles.title: AfriForum says SAHRC must deliver on promise to take Malema to Equality Court over hate speech - News24
articles.description: AfriForum says it is keeping a watchful eye over the hate speech case of EFF leader Julius Malema to ensure that he is taken to the Equality Court by the South African Human Rights Commission.
articles.content:
• AfriForum says it expects Malema to be taken to the Equality Court by the SAHRC.
  • The 10 days Malema was given by the SAHRC to retract and apologise for hate speech has expired.

articles.description: Musk emailed employees on Friday looking for staff who could "write software" and asked them to gather at Twitter headquarters later in the day.
articles.content:

articles.author: Heather Robertson
articles.title: LETTER FROM THE EDITOR: The ANC's national jamboree. It's craven, crass, ugly stuff, hidden under the guise of striving for 'a better life for all' South Africans. - Daily Maverick
articles.description: Sadly, after being voted into power for five consecutive terms, we all know that the better life for all has become a bunfight for a much better life for ANC cadres, their friends and families. But there are also green shoots of hope.
articles.content:
Dear DM168 readers,
As I write this letter on Friday, 18 November, it is 27 days before the governing partys national conference on 16 December. Where they will elect leaders to steer the party into… [+4952 chars]

articles.author: Tariro Washinyira
articles.title: About 500 refugees are still living in wretched conditions in Cape Town camp - News24
articles.description: About 500 refugees, including 200 children, remain at Paint City in Bellville. They still refuse to return to South African communities and cling to the dream of being relocated to another country.
articles.content:
• Five hundred people are still living at Paint City in Bellville, without proper sanitation.
  • They still want to be resettled in another country, but the UNHCR says there is little pros… [+3872 chars]
